title: How to Manage Files on a Gamecube Memory Card

steps.headline: Make sure the GameCube is ready.
steps.description: Plug it in, insert both memory cards, and turn it on.

steps.headline: Get to the system menu.
steps.description: This is done either by starting off the system with no disc in or the lid open, or holding A while it first turns on.

steps.headline: Get to the memory card screen.
steps.description: On the cube, it is the bottom option.

steps.headline: Manage the files.
steps.description:
Slot A will be displayed on the left, slot B on the right. Select your file with the control stick and press A to see options for that file - which are, in this order up from down:
Move: Moves the file to the other memory card, not leaving itself behind. Copy: Duplicates the file over to the other memory card, leaves itself behind. Erase: This erases the file for good. Not to be taken lightly.

text:
Make sure the GameCube is ready. Plug it in, insert both memory cards, and turn it on. Get to the system menu. This is done either by starting off the system with no disc in or the lid open, or holding A while it first turns on. Get to the memory card screen. On the cube, it is the bottom option. Manage the files. Slot A will be displayed on the left, slot B on the right. Select your file with the control stick and press A to see options for that file - which are, in this order up from down:
Move: Moves the file to the other memory card, not leaving itself behind. Copy: Duplicates the file over to the other memory card, leaves itself behind. Erase: This erases the file for good. Not to be taken lightly.
